body_html:
Just piping up with some anecdotal (and so useless) news, but when i run tests (e.g bazel test //tensorflow/c:c_api_test) on my Mac (10.12.6) with current XCode and no attempted gcc updates, it uses clang successfully.

autogenic:tensorflow xx$ clang -v
Apple LLVM version 8.1.0 (clang-802.0.42)
Target: x86_64-apple-darwin16.7.0
Thread model: posix
InstalledDir: /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin
autogenic:tensorflow xx$

The only peeps of complaint regarding flags that i see are

clang: warning: argument unused during compilation: '-pthread' [-Wunused-command-line-argument]

I also just reran the c_api_test including -c opt to see if that triggered a similar warning but saw no new problems.

body:
Just piping up with some anecdotal (and so useless) news, but when i run tests (e.g `bazel test //tensorflow/c:c_api_test`) on my Mac (10.12.6) with current XCode and no attempted gcc updates, it uses clang successfully.
```
autogenic:tensorflow xx$ clang -v
Apple LLVM version 8.1.0 (clang-802.0.42)
Target: x86_64-apple-darwin16.7.0
Thread model: posix
InstalledDir: /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin
autogenic:tensorflow xx$ 
```

The only peeps of complaint regarding flags that i see are
```
clang: warning: argument unused during compilation: '-pthread' [-Wunused-command-line-argument]
```

I also just reran the c_api_test including `-c opt` to see if that triggered a similar warning but saw no new problems.
